title: Thiago Motta : Man United - linked manager says  final decision  over his future will be made in  next few days  - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:
Bologna boss Thiago Motta has addressed speculation surrounding his future at the Serie A club even as he continues to be strongly linked with a move to Manchester United.
Motta has been mentioned as one of the alternatives being explored by Sir Jim Ratcliffe and INEOS to potentially replace Erik ten Hag at United.
Itâ€™s looking increasingly likely that Ten Hagâ€™s time at Old Trafford is up and in preparation for the possibility of his exit, INEOS are believed to be making plans to bring in a successor as soon as possible.
Motta has earned praise this season for his attractive brand of football and fearless football philosophy, which secured Bologna European football for the first time in more than two decades. Even more impressive is that Bologna will be making their bow in the Champions League.
Motta is also being eyed by Juventus and AC Milan.
A recent report covered by The Peoples Person relayed that Juventus offered the former Paris Saint-Germain and Inter Milan midfielder a three-year deal to assume the hot seat in Turin.
On Friday, Juventus announced the sacking of Massimiliano Allegri, two days after the club won the Coppa Italia against Atalanta.
The Bianconeri attributed the parting of ways with Allegri to his antics on the touchline on that occasion. Allegri lost his cool in stoppage time as he ripped off his jacket and had an awkward encounter with match officials.
Amidst interest in his services from outfits like United and Juventus, Motta has now weighed in on his situation and what the future holds for him.
